title.rendered: Find Rooms for Rent in East New York

content.rendered:
East New York, although occupied predominantly by black Americans, is a liberal and racially diverse community. If you are looking for a dense, urban space, this populated district on the Eastern front of Brooklyn is the place to be. In this guide, we will cover all you need to know when looking for rooms for rent in East New York, including average rent, safety, restaurants, and parks in East New York.

Related: Find rooms for Rent in Carroll Gardens, Brooklyn

Where is East New York?

East New York lies south of Cypress Hill Cemetery, north of Jamaica Bay, west of Queens, and east of the rail yards near Van Sinderen Avenue. Gentrification may have touched most parts of Brooklyn, but not here. Perhaps this is because the enclave is at the far outskirts of the borough.

Keep reading to find out more about rooms for rent in East New York!

Find Rooms For Rent in East New York

Find Rooms For Rent In East New York, Brooklyn

East New York is a renter’s paradise. Up to 78% of available houses are occupied by renters. For a neighborhood with over 140,000 residents, this is quite significant. The houses are predominantly semi-detached, multi-unit row houses, but you will find that a few condo complexes are also beginning to spring up.

Average rent in East New York

Is East New York safe?

East New York has a reputation for being unsafe because its crime rates used to be way above national averages. However, under the watch of the 75th Precinct of the New York City Police Department, there has been a drastic reduction in the number of crimes committed in the area. If you are looking to find rooms for rent in East New York, here are some apps and numbers you should be aware of

  1. Hotlines: Dial 911 immediately in an emergency. Response time is as quick as possible. In non-emergent situations, you should use 311. Call this number to report issues relating to abandoned vehicles, bad roads, noise from neighbors, and graffiti.
  2. AroundMe: AroundMe is helpful when you need to find hospitals, supermarkets, pharmacies, and the like nearby. It gives you real-time info on pricing, directions, details and more to help you make safe choices. It is a necessary app to use while looking for rooms for rent in East New York.

Public Transit in East New York

1. Walkability

East New York is the 125th most walkable neighborhood in New York with a Walk Score of 84. You can easily access anywhere you need to go on foot.

2. Roads & Traffic

The roads are busy, and the traffic is heavy due to the population in the area. Plus, the nearby Gateway Mall brings people in from outside the neighborhood.

3. Nearby Train station

There is easy access to the train network through two subway stations: the New Lots Av and the Van Siclen Av. These stations are served by the 2, 3, 4, 5 lines and the A, C lines respectively.

4. Nearby Bus Stops

East New York has two bus stations, the New Lots Av and the Sutter Av, and is served by three bus lines, the B!%, B83, and B14.

Restaurants in East New York

1. Lindenwood Diner

Here, you get the usual American diner classics alongside southern delicacies and Latin Caribbean specialties. Whether you are dining in or ordering a take-out, Lindenwood Diner has got you covered.

Get Directions

2. El Rey II Restaurant

If you are a fan of Spanish and Dominican cuisines, this is your go-to restaurant in East New York. The menu offers a diverse array of options for every meal of the day!

Opening Hours: 7am – 12am, daily

Get Directions

3. BKLYN Eats

For a small diner, BKLYN Eats offers quality food made from fresh ingredients for breakfast and lunch. It’s a favorite amongst locals and offers free delivery, whether you’re eating at home, the office, or on a job site. This is definitely one of the top restaurants in East New York.

Get Directions
Order Online

Related: Things to Do in Brooklyn

Parks and Recreation in East New York

Shirley Chisholm State Park

This 47-acres wide park, opened in 2019, is located along the shores of Jamaica. When it is finished in 2021, it will be the third biggest park in Brooklyn. It offers scintillating views of the Empire State Building, Verrazano-Narrows Bridge, New York Harbor, and Jamaica Bay.

Highland Park

This park in East New York is home to over 151 species of bird and gives you a stunning view of the Atlantic Ocean, Ridgewood Reservoir, and the Rockaways.

The Fresh Creek Nature Preserve

Although not completely open to the public, this nature park is rich in plants and bustling with wildlife. The salt marsh reserve provides cool scenery and is a great place for picnicking. Thus, it is an ideal center for recreation in East New York.

Shopping in East New York

Gateway Center

Also known as the Gateway Mall. There are about 46 chain stores in the mall, including favorites like Best Buy, Target, Home Depot, and Old Navy. The complex also has several restaurants and is served by a direct bus, has a digital shopping directory, and complimentary parking spaces, which allows you to enjoy shopping in East New York safely.

Get Directions

East New York Deli & Grocery

Shopping in East New York is possible anytime because of this store, which is open 24 hours a day, 7 days a week. It is a licensed retail food store and you can get your groceries at the best prices here.

Get Directions

D’you know what else Roomi does outside of helping its readers find rooms for rent in East New York? With our ever-increasing lists of rooms and roommates across the world, we help you find your perfect match!

DOWNLOAD THE APP NOW!
